OperatorName: AgVantage FS Div of GROWMARK, Inc.

_prev_prog_2.EquipmentTested: Visual - Storage tank, nurse tanks, shutoff valves, relief valves, plumbing, breakways, hoses, and liquid pump

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

1.Facility accidental release and emergency response policy.

The management and employees of AgVantage FS are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the  West Branch Fire Department, Cedar County  Local Emergency Planning Committee or other authorities, to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and environment.

2.The stationary source and the regulated substance handled.

The primary activity at the facility, which is located at 202 PeeDee Street, Downey, IA  is the storage and blending of fertilizer for sale to farmers.  Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored, and distributed for direct application as a crop production nutrient.  The storage and handling system consists of a storage tank, loading risers associated plumbing and nurse tanks.  Access to the site is restricted to authorized facility employees, authorized management personnel and authorized contractors. 
3. The accidental release prevention program.

This facility complies with EPA's Accidental Release Prevention Rule and with all applicable state codes and regulations. This facility has implemented the provisions of "Safety Requirements for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, ANSI/CGA G-2.1-2014", published by The American National Standards Institute, Inc. as adopted by state regulation and the standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia". Compliance with these regulations and on-going training of our employees make up our accident release prevention program.


4.The accidental release prevention program.

This facility complies with EPA's Accidental Release Prevention Rule and with all applicable state codes and regulations. This facility has implemented the provisions of "Safety Requirements for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous A

mmonia, K-61.1", published by The American National Standards Institute, Inc. as adopted by state regulation and the standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration(OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia". Compliance with these regulations and on-going training of our employees make up our accident release prevention program.

5.Historical information on this facility.

There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years , that to our knowledge have resulted in offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, shelter in place, or environmental damage.


6.The emergency response program.

This facility has:
-A written emergency action plan, in accordance with OSHA standard,29 CFR 1910.38:
-provided state and local authorities the emergency planning and community right-to-know information as required under SARA Title III (EPCRA). In the event of an emergency involving anhydrous ammonia, it is our policy to notify West Branch  Fire Department and Cedar County  LEPC and request that they respond to the emergency.  Our emergency action plans have been coordinated with both  the fire department and LEPC. This facility is a non-responding facility.

7. Planned changes to improve safety.

Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility. Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the maintenance of safe conditions. There are no specific safety recommendations for implementation at this time.
